speak.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to talk to someone about something
speak.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I know her by sight, but not to speak to (=not well enough to talk to her).
I spoke to her last Wednesday.
‘Hello, may I speak to Jim Smith?’ ‘Yes, speaking (=used on the telephone)’.
I haven’t spoken to Steve about all this.
They did not want to speak with reporters.
It was the first time she had ever spoken of marriage.
speak.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to use your voice to produce words
speak.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I was so shocked I couldn’t speak.
speak.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to be able to talk in a particular language
speak.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I don’t speak a word of French  (=do not speak any French at all).
Several children in the class can’t speak English.
speak.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Jones spoke at the teachers’ annual convention.
She asked me to speak to her students about my work in marketing.
Only one MP spoke against the bill.
speak.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to say something that expresses your ideas or opinions
speak.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: He emphasized that he was speaking as a private citizen, not in any official capacity.
Her co-workers spoke highly of her.
It’s wrong to speak ill of the dead.
Strictly speaking, it’s my money, not yours. I earned it.
speak.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 5: to say something that expresses your ideas or opinions
speak.translation[0].note_box[0].section: He always spoke very highly of Marge.
She never speaks ill of him.
Speaking personally, yes, this is a worry.
Strictly speaking, the tomato is a fruit.
Generally speaking, the results have been good.
These innovations are, roughly speaking, what this book is about.
Relatively speaking, property there is still cheap.
Speaking as a medical man, I'd advise you to take some exercise every day.
speak.translation[0].note_box[1].section: to be able to talk in a foreign language
I learnt Spanish for years, but I still don’t speak it very well.
to be very good at speaking and understanding a foreign language, so that you can speak it almost as well as your own language
Applicants should be fluent in Cantonese.
to speak enough of a language to be able to buy things, ask for help etc
‘What’s your Italian like?’ ‘Not great, but I can get by.’
I’ve just bought a book called ‘Get by in Portuguese'.
have/pick up a smattering of something
to speak or learn to speak a small but useful amount of a language
While I was in Bali, I picked up a smattering of Indonesian.
speak.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the special language or difficult words that are used in a particular business or activity
speak.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: added to other words to form nouns that mean the special language of a particular business or activity, especially slang or technical words that are difficult for ordinary people to understand
